parameters.name: publish_sop
parameters.description:
Creates or updates an SOP (Standard Operating Procedure) in the Notion SOP database. Use this tool when:
- The user asks to create a new SOP
- You learn something that should be documented as a procedure
- An existing SOP needs to be updated with new information
- The user wants to save a workflow pattern or best practice

The tool will automatically check if an SOP with the same name exists and update it, or create a new one if not found.

Returns: { success: boolean, action: 'create'|'update', sopName, notionPageId, notionUrl }

values.name: sopName
values.description: The title/name of the SOP (REQUIRED). Should be clear and descriptive, e.g., 'Customer Onboarding Process' or 'Lead Enrichment Pipeline'

values.name: sopId
values.description: Unique identifier for the SOP. If not provided, one will be auto-generated. Format: SOP-XXX

values.name: quickSummary
values.description: A 1-2 sentence summary of what this SOP covers. Helps with searchability.

values.name: content
values.description: The full content/body of the SOP in markdown format. Include steps, notes, examples.

values.name: status
values.description: The SOP status. Options: Draft, Active, Archived, Under Review. Defaults to 'Draft'

values.name: category
values.description: The category this SOP belongs to. Examples: Operations, Sales, Engineering, Support

values.name: priority
values.description: Priority level: Low, Medium, High, Critical. Defaults to 'Medium'

values.name: tags
values.description: Comma-separated list of tags for categorization. Example: 'automation,n8n,lead-gen'

values.name: source
values.description: Where this SOP originated from. Defaults to 'Agent-Generated'

values.name: version
values.description: Version number of the SOP. Defaults to '1.0'
